intro: Astragalus salatavicus, commonly known as the Salta Valley milkvetch, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It plays a role in soil stabilization and is sometimes used in traditional medicine. Its ecological significance is notable in its native habitats due to its ability to thrive in harsh conditions.
